intro: Torrubia cafferiana, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in suitable environments.
